conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effects of light source position.
Shadows A, B, C, and D are cast to the left of the objects.
Light source is currently to the right of the objects.
Light source moves to the front right, closer and forward.
Shadows will shift to the back left as the light source moves to the front right.
Shadows will become larger when the light source moves closer.
Shadows will stretch more in the direction away from the light source.
Shadow A will move to the back left and become larger, stretching more towards the back left.
Shadow B will move to the back left and become larger, stretching more towards the back left.
Shadow C will move to the back left and become larger, stretching more towards the back left.
Shadow D will move to the back left and become larger, stretching more towards the back left.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the back left and become larger, stretching more towards the back left.
